titles.title: Expressing the strong support of the Congress for the recently concluded elections in the Republic of India and urging the President to travel to India.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on International Relations.

bill.summary: 10/27/1999--Introduced. Congratulates: (1) the people of the Republic of India on the successful conclusion of their recent national elections; and (2) Prime Minister Atal Bihari Vajpayee on his re-election.Calls on the President to travel to India as part of any trip to South Asia.Urges the President to use the authority granted to him by the Congress in the Department of Defense Appropriations Act, 2000 to pursue a broad-based strategic relationship with India..
